Dish | Meta's Pappy JELL-O shots and more

Dana McMahan, Special to The Courier-Journal 12:32 p.m. EST November 10, 2014

Jeremy Johnson of Meta (Photo: Dana McMahan, Special to The Courier-Journal )

3 CONNECT 2 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Cocktail lounge Meta, 425 W Chestnut St., made national news over the weekend when they served up Pappy Van Winkle JELL-O shots $10 petite Old Fashioned cocktails featuring the sought-after bourbon. The move, owner Jeremy Johnson's way to poke fun at Pappy mania and the allocation process, drew both ire and applause.

Esquire TV has been filming in Louisville the last few days, working on episodes of two of their cable network shows. The hosts of "Best Bars in America" visited the The Old Seelbach Bar, Joe's Older Than Dirt and Holy Grale. "Brew Dogs" is at Against the Grain brewery (401 E. Main St.) Monday, featuring a Kentucky-focused beer with the show's hosts a pair of Scottish brewers. A filmed tasting celebration party takes place at 6:15 p.m. Stay tuned to Dish for the episodes' air date.

Rumplings Slurp Shop, the gourmet ramen noodle shop from Griffin Paulin and Dustin Staggers of Roux, opened at 2009 Highland Ave. Friday. Hours are Wednesday through Saturday from 5 p.m. to 5 a.m. and the menu ranges from $5.50 to $17.

LouVino, 1606 Bardstown Road, has launched a new menu. Among the dishes: lamb loin chop with truffle mushroom risotto; braised short rib Gruyere mac and cheese; shrimp and grit cake with crispy country ham, spicy maple syrup and sunny side up egg; and pumpkin whoopie pies.

On Nov. 19, 25 percent of diners' checks at several dozen participating restaurant will be donated to House of Ruth to support people with or affected by HIV/AIDS. Find the list at http://www.houseofruth.net/2014-dining-out-for-life/.

Due to popular demand, Varanese Restaurant, 2106 Frankfort Avenue, will host a second "Brown-Forman Bourbon Dinner" Thursday, beginning at 6:30 p.m. The event features a debut of Old Forester's new 1870 Original Batch and a four-course dinner paired with a bourbon flight and Brown-Forman bourbon cocktails. The dinner costs $55, plus tax and tip.

COURIER-JOURNAL

Joey McFarland of Louisville is producer of Dumb and Dumber To

Sidebar, 129 N. Second St., will host a Garrison Texas bourbon dinner at 6 p.m. Nov. 18, featuring a three-course steak dinner paired with Garrison bourbon. Proprietor Dan Garrison will be on hand to tell the distillery's story.

Holly Hill Inn in Midway will host its annual cassoulet dinner Sunday, with a traditional Southwestern French dish featuring white beans, duck confit, and local pork, local lamb and garlic sausage. The event kicks off the restaurant's holiday season. Doors open at 6:30 p.m.
